datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to digital security, online threats, and safeguarding data.

columns.name: previous_cyber_attacks
columns.description: Number of previous cyber attacks the organization has faced

columns.name: uses_encryption_technologies
columns.description: Indicates if the organization uses encryption technologies for protecting data.

columns.name: percentage_of_critical_data
columns.description: The percentage of total data handled by the organization that is classified as sensitive or critical.

columns.name: annual_cyber_incidents
columns.description: Number of cyber incidents reported by the organization annually

columns.name: annual_cyber_attacks
columns.description: The total number of externally originating cyber attacks an organization experiences each year.

columns.name: cybersecurity_software_updates
columns.description: Indicates whether the organization regularly updates its cybersecurity software.

columns.name: two_factor_authentication
columns.description: Whether the organization uses two-factor authentication (Yes/No).

columns.name: mandatory_compliance_certification
columns.description: Indicates if all IT staff are required to have security compliance certifications.

columns.name: total_employees
columns.description: Total number of employees in the organization

columns.name: organization_sector
columns.description: The sector to which the organization belongs.

columns.name: cybersecurity_training_budget
columns.description: Annual budget for cybersecurity training per employee in dollars

columns.name: monthly_update_frequency
columns.description: Frequency of cybersecurity software updates per year.

columns.name: annual_revenue
columns.description: Annual revenue of the organization

columns.name: percentage_of_IT_staff
columns.description: Percentage of total employees that are part of the IT department.

columns.name: number_of_cybersecurity_incidents
columns.description: Total number of cybersecurity incidents reported by the organization in the past year.

columns.name: percent_employees_accessing_sensitive_data
columns.description: Percentage of employees who have access to sensitive or critical data.

columns.name: has_dedicated_IT_security_team
columns.description: Whether the organization has a dedicated IT security team.

columns.name: frequency_of_software_updates
columns.description: The number of times the organization updates its software in a year.

columns.name: industry_sector
columns.description: Sector of the industry the organization operates in

columns.name: requires_regular_password_updates
columns.description: Whether the organization has a policy requiring employees to update their passwords regularly.

columns.name: security_employee_ratio
columns.description: Ratio of IT security staff to the total number of employees.

columns.name: regular_cybersecurity_audits
columns.description: Indicates whether regular cybersecurity audits are conducted.

columns.name: cyber_attack_frequency
columns.description: How often the organization experiences cyber attacks.

columns.name: security_update_frequency
columns.description: Frequency at which the organization performs security updates or patches.

columns.name: mandatory_cybersecurity_training
columns.description: Indicates whether the organization requires all employees to undergo cybersecurity training.

columns.name: incident_report_to_resolution_ratio
columns.description: Ratio of the number of cybersecurity incidents reported to the number of incidents resolved.

columns.name: number_of_IT_security_staff
columns.description: The total number of IT security staff employed by the organization.

queries.question: Is there a relationship between the percentage of critical data handled by organizations and the number of security updates they perform? How does the frequency of security updates relate to the percentage of IT staff in organizations within the cybersecurity domain?
